programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy starring Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell. Cynical TV weatherman Phil Connors is sent to cover the annual Groundhog Day festival at a small town in Pennsylvania. Stranded by a snowstorm, which he failed to predict, Phil wakes up the following morning to discover that it's still the day before, and it slowly dawns on the world-weary forecaster that he'll never have to worry about tomorrow Harold Ramis - Director Bill Murray - Phil Connors Andie MacDowell - Rita Hanson Chris Elliott - Larry Stephen Tobolowsky - Ned Brian Doyle-Murray - Buster Marita Geraghty - Nancy Angela Paton - Mrs Lancaster Rick Ducommun - Gus Rick Overton - Ralph Robin Duke - Doris the waitress Carol Bivins - Anchorwoman Michael Shannon - Fred Bill Murray - Phil Connors Andie MacDowell - Rita Hanson Chris Elliott - Larry Stephen Tobolowsky - Ned Brian Doyle-Murray - Buster Marita Geraghty - Nancy Angela Paton - Mrs Lancaster Rick Ducommun - Gus Rick Overton - Ralph Robin Duke - Doris the waitress Carol Bivins - Anchorwoman Michael Shannon - Fred.

programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Sandra Bullock and Hugh Grant. When she resigns after growing tired of her eccentric, disorganised boss, talented lawyer Lucy Kelson is given the job of finding her own replacement. But after hiring beautiful Harvard law graduate June Carter, Lucy begins to wonder if she's made the right decision Marc Lawrence (2) - Director Sandra Bullock - Lucy Kelson Hugh Grant - George Wade Alicia Witt - June Carter Dana Ivey - Ruth Kelson Robert Klein - Larry Kelson Heather Burns - Meryl David Haig - Howard Wade Dorian Missick - Tony Donald Trump - Donald Trump Norah Jones - Norah Jones Sandra Bullock - Lucy Kelson Hugh Grant - George Wade Alicia Witt - June Carter Dana Ivey - Ruth Kelson Robert Klein - Larry Kelson Heather Burns - Meryl David Haig - Howard Wade Dorian Missick - Tony Donald Trump - Donald Trump Norah Jones - Norah Jones.

programme.title: Superman II

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.sub-title: Fantasy, Drama, Sci Fi, Action, Thriller ║ 2023 ║ 12A
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. programme.title: The Mask of Zorro
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Drama, Romance, Thriller, Western ║ 1998 ║ PG
programme.desc: Swashbuckling action adventure starring Antonio Banderas and Anthony Hopkins. Twenty years after his last appearance, legendary hero Zorro returns to battle Don Rafael Montero, now the self-styled ruler of mid-19th-century California. But is this the original "Robin Hood of Mexico" or a younger incarnation who now defends the rights of peasants? n Martin Campbell - Director Antonio Banderas - Alejandro Murrieta / Zorro Anthony Hopkins - Zorro / Don Diego de la Vega Stuart Wilson (1) - Don Rafael Montero Catherine Zeta-Jones - Elena Matt Letscher - Captain Harrison Love Maury Chaykin - Prison warden L Q Jones - Three-Fingered Jack Victor Rivers - Joaquin Murrieta Antonio Banderas - Alejandro Murrieta / Zorro Anthony Hopkins - Zorro / Don Diego de la Vega Stuart Wilson (1) - Don Rafael Montero Catherine Zeta-Jones - Elena Matt Letscher - Captain Harrison Love Maury Chaykin - Prison warden L Q Jones - Three-Fingered Jack Victor Rivers - Joaquin Murrieta.

programme.title: Munich
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Eric Bana and Daniel Craig. Following the assassination of 11 Israeli athletes at the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, Israel's Prime Minister Golda Meir recruits a hit squad to track down and execute the 11 Palestinian leaders held responsible for the atrocity. The team is led by Mossad agent Avner, but, as the killings mount up, a heavy toll is paid by the men Steven Spielberg - Director Eric Bana - Avner Daniel Craig - Steve Ciaran Hinds - Carl Mathieu Kassovitz - Robert Hanns Zischler - Hans Ayelet Zurer - Daphna Geoffrey Rush - Ephraim Michel Lonsdale - Papa Mathieu Amalric - Louis Lynn Cohen - Golda Meir Moritz Bleibtreu - Andreas Valéria Bruni-Tedeschi - Sylvie Marie-Josée Croze - Jeanette Yvan Attal - Tony Brian Goodman - Belligerent American Richard Brake - Belligerent American Robert Burke - Belligerent American Eric Bana - Avner Daniel Craig - Steve Ciaran Hinds - Carl Mathieu Kassovitz - Robert Hanns Zischler - Hans Ayelet Zurer - Daphna Geoffrey Rush - Ephraim Michel Lonsdale - Papa Mathieu Amalric - Louis Lynn Cohen - Golda Meir Moritz Bleibtreu - Andreas Valéria Bruni-Tedeschi - Sylvie Marie-Josée Croze - Jeanette Yvan Attal - Tony Brian Goodman - Belligerent American Richard Brake - Belligerent American Robert Burke - Belligerent American.

However, fate compels the duo to reconsider, and they seize the opportunity to attend a lavish wedding in Australia, as a couple. The pair pretend to be deliriously in love during the once-in-a-lifetime trip and keep up appearances in front of other guests. programme.title: Snack Shack
programme.desc: Coming-of-age comedy drama starring Conor Sherry and Gabriel LaBelle. In 1990s Nebraska, best friends AJ and Moose need to find summer jobs. When they get the chance to take over the dilapidated refreshment stand at their local swimming pool, the pair throw themselves into their new venture - much to the horror of their parents and delight of their friends. But their shared affection for lifeguard Brooke threatens to come between them Adam Rehmeier - Director Conor Sherry - AJ Gabriel LaBelle - Moose Mika Abdalla - Brooke Nick Robinson - Shane David Costabile - Judge Gillian Vigman - Jean Conor Sherry - AJ Gabriel LaBelle - Moose Mika Abdalla - Brooke Nick Robinson - Shane David Costabile - Judge Gillian Vigman - Jean.

programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Layla Mohammadi. programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. Decades later, Winton's records of the mission reawaken painful memories of the youngsters he couldn't save - and set him on an unexpected path to laying his ghosts to rest James Hawes - Director Anthony Hopkins - Nicholas Winton Helena Bonham Carter - Babette Winton Johnny Flynn - Nicholas, as a young man Lena Olin - Grete Winton Romola Garai - Doreen Warriner Jonathan Pryce - Martin Blake Ziggy Heath - Martin Blake, as a young man Adrian Rawlins - Geoff Samantha Spiro - Esther Rantzen Marthe Keller - Betty Maxwell Alex Sharp - Trevor Anthony Hopkins - Nicholas Winton Helena Bonham Carter - Babette Winton Johnny Flynn - Nicholas, as a young man Lena Olin - Grete Winton Romola Garai - Doreen Warriner Jonathan Pryce - Martin Blake Ziggy Heath - Martin Blake, as a young man Adrian Rawlins - Geoff Samantha Spiro - Esther Rantzen Marthe Keller - Betty Maxwell Alex Sharp - Trevor.

programme.sub-title: Family, Musical, Romance, Drama, Music, Comedy, Arts And Culture ║ 1978 ║ PG
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. programme.title: Hu Tu Tu

programme.desc: Movie was so famous for their songs and choreography also won Many awards for Best Cinematographer, Best Choreography.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Johnny Flynn. programme.title: Snack Shack
programme.desc: Coming-of-age comedy drama starring Conor Sherry and Gabriel LaBelle. In 1990s Nebraska, best friends AJ and Moose need to find summer jobs. When they get the chance to take over the dilapidated refreshment stand at their local swimming pool, the pair throw themselves into their new venture - much to the horror of their parents and delight of their friends. But their shared affection for lifeguard Brooke threatens to come between them Adam Rehmeier - Director Conor Sherry - AJ Gabriel LaBelle - Moose Mika Abdalla - Brooke Nick Robinson - Shane David Costabile - Judge Gillian Vigman - Jean Conor Sherry - AJ Gabriel LaBelle - Moose Mika Abdalla - Brooke Nick Robinson - Shane David Costabile - Judge Gillian Vigman - Jean.

programme.desc: Two teenage boys from different London backgrounds embark on a road trip North together. As they open up about their pasts, the lads learn they have more in common than they thought. programme.title: The Persian Version
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Layla Mohammadi. programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. Decades later, Winton's records of the mission reawaken painful memories of the youngsters he couldn't save - and set him on an unexpected path to laying his ghosts to rest James Hawes - Director Anthony Hopkins - Nicholas Winton Helena Bonham Carter - Babette Winton Johnny Flynn - Nicholas, as a young man Lena Olin - Grete Winton Romola Garai - Doreen Warriner Jonathan Pryce - Martin Blake Ziggy Heath - Martin Blake, as a young man Adrian Rawlins - Geoff Samantha Spiro - Esther Rantzen Marthe Keller - Betty Maxwell Alex Sharp - Trevor Anthony Hopkins - Nicholas Winton Helena Bonham Carter - Babette Winton Johnny Flynn - Nicholas, as a young man Lena Olin - Grete Winton Romola Garai - Doreen Warriner Jonathan Pryce - Martin Blake Ziggy Heath - Martin Blake, as a young man Adrian Rawlins - Geoff Samantha Spiro - Esther Rantzen Marthe Keller - Betty Maxwell Alex Sharp - Trevor.
